## base.AnyMatcher class

The base class for all Test Equivalence Matchers. Extend this if you don't have an example in your Matcher. Otherwise, use [base.AnyMatcherWithExample](./test-equivalence-matchers.base.anymatcherwithexample.md)

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare abstract class AnyMatcher
```

| Constructor                                                                                | Modifiers | Description                                                    |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | --------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [(constructor)(matcherType)](./test-equivalence-matchers.base.anymatcher._constructor_.md) |           | Constructs a new instance of the <code>AnyMatcher</code> class |

## Methods

| Method                                                            | Modifiers | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [toJSON()](./test-equivalence-matchers.base.anymatcher.tojson.md) |           | <p>Only override this method if you are writing a matcher in a language other than TypeScript.</p><p>It exists because the ContractCase matcher format is not legal in all languages that ContractCase supports.</p><p>WARNING: Do not return a string from this method. You must instead return an object that can be serialised to JSON following the matcher format described in \[Extending ContractCase\](https://case.contract-testing.io/docs/advanced-topics/extending-case).</p> |
